raw_text:
Baywatch dubbed 'worst TV import'
 
 Surf show Baywatch has won the title of worst TV import of all time in a poll of UK television executives.
 
 The programme, which starred David Hasselhoff and Pamela Anderson during its 12-year run, was shown in 140 countries at its height. Model Anna Nicole Smith's reality show and The Dukes of Hazzard were runners-up in the Broadcast magazine survey. The Simpsons and Dallas and 24 were among the magazine's list of the best all-time imports from the US. Soap operas Knots Landing, Falcon Crest plus The Bold And The Beautiful all made the top 10 of Transatlantic TV howlers. The Jerry Springer Show, which came in at sixth on the list, did not fare well.
 
 Broadcast magazine said: "British TV never realised how low it could go before Jerry showed the way." Baywatch rose to the top of the list for having "mind-numbingly predictable scripts: beachgoer is saved from drowning," according to the magazine. Just inside the all-time worst top 10 came Extreme Makeover, which sees members of the public given thousands of pounds worth of plastic surgery. Other American shows which won praise were The X-Files, I Love Lucy, Twin Peaks and Star Trek.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I have this query where the user wants a summary of a provided text. Let me read through it carefully to understand what they're asking for.

The original text is about Baywatch being called the worst TV import ever, based on a poll by UK executives. It mentions specific shows like The Dukes of Hazzard and others winning in the survey. There are also details about how different shows rank in terms of all-time imports from the US. 

I need to condense this into just plain text without any explanations or formatting. So, I'll identify the key points: Baywatch is the worst import, it's been on TV for 12 years, stars David Hasselhoff and Pamela Anderson, watched in over 140 countries, and did well against US shows like The X-Files, Twin Peaks, etc., but was ranked sixth. It didn't go as high as the top 10. 

I should make sure to mention that British TV hasn't realized how low it can go before Baywatch. Also, include the details about how other American shows performed in that poll.

Alright, putting it all together into a concise summary without any extra information.
</think>

The program "Baywatch" was deemed the worst TV import ever by UK executives, according to a poll conducted by Broadcast magazine. It starred David Hasselhoff and Pamela Anderson since its 12-year run. The show was widely watched in over 140 countries and ranked sixth on the list of all-time imports from the US. Other top shows included The X-Files, Twin Peaks, and I Love Lucy. Baywatch did not reach the highest ranking for British TV ever, which wasn't achieved by "Jerry Spring's Show," a drama that came in at sixth place instead.

The Simpsonesque soap opera Knoç Landing, Falcon Crest, The Bold & The Beautiful, Jerry Springer Show, and The Jerry Springer Show were also noteworthy offenders on the list for their predictability.

Jerry Springer's show was the sixth worst in the survey, while Extreme Makeover received praise for its plastic surgery episodes.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Baywatch, a 12-year-old beach patrol series featuring David Hasselhoff and Pamela Anderson, was named the worst TV import in a UK television executives' poll by Broadcast magazine. The show, initially broadcast in 140 countries, lost to other American imports like The Dukes of Hazzard (runners-up) and was criticized for its predictable scripts focusing on rescuing beachgoers from drowning. Other notable U.S. shows that performed well included The X-Files, I Love Lucy, Twin Peaks, Star Trek, and soap operas such as Knots Landing, Falcon Crest, and The Bold And The Beautiful. Shows like The Jerry Springer Show, Extreme Makeover, and others with more creative or thought-provoking content fared better in the poll.
